Leading with Intentionality: The 4P Framework for Strategic Leadership

In This Section

  • Faculty
    & Research
    • Publications
      • Faculty Papers and Publications
      • Publications by Centers & Initiatives
      • Student Publications

You are here

  • Home
  • Faculty & Research
  • Publications
  • Faculty Papers and Publications
  • Leading with Intentionality: The 4P Framework for Strategic Leadership
HKS Faculty Research Working Paper Series
HKS Working Paper No. RWP20-029
September 2020
Download PDF

HKS Authors

See citation below for complete author information.

Robert Wilkinson
Lecturer in Public Policy and Leadership
Kimberlyn Leary
Lecturer in Public Policy, HKS; Associate Professor of Psychology, HMS; Associate Professor in the Department of Health Policy and Management, HSPH

Abstract

The ability to exercise leadership effectively requires skills and capacities that must be developed; they are not innate. Leadership is rarely making one decision and sticking to it, or making a grand development happen with a touch. Mostly, leadership is non-heroic and involves painstaking work, paying attention, and being able to learn quickly and in real time.

Citation

Wilkinson, Robert, and Kimberlyn Leary. "Leading with Intentionality: The 4P Framework for Strategic Leadership." HKS Faculty Research Working Paper Series RWP20-029, September 2020.

79 John F. Kennedy Street

Cambridge, MA 02138

617-495-1100
